intro: Lithocarpus kuarunensis var. lepidobalanus, commonly known as the golden-barked tecton. It is a species of evergreen tree native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and produces坚果-like fruits that are typically dispersed by animals. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is known for its ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments. The botanical features of this variant make it an important component of the forest ecosystem.
